root.data: The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita is calculated as the percentage change in real GDP per capita between two consecutive years. Real GDP per capita is calculated by dividing GDP at constant prices by the population of a country or region. Real GDP data is measured in constant US dollars to facilitate the calculation of the country's growth rates, their respective aggregation and comparability between countries or regions.
